comment.author: 65171012@N00
comment._content:
1912 was Jeff Tesreau's rookie year with the New York Giants (NL).  In the regular season, he picthed 36 games (starting 28 and completing 19) and led the league with a 1.96 ERA.  He started 3 games (going 1-2) in the 1912 World Series against Boston.  Boston won the series in 8 games.  Yes, 8 games!  Game 2, played in Boston, was called because of darkness.  

Tesreau was on a squad that included Christy Mathewson and Rube Marquard.
